FAQs

Disclaimer

These services are wellness modalities and are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent disease. Always consult your licensed healthcare provider for medical concerns.

How do I book?

Use our online scheduler or call/text us. Same-day bookings are subject to availability.

What’s your cancellation policy?

Please cancel or reschedule ≥24 hours before your appointment to avoid a late-cancel fee. No-shows are charged the full session rate.

Do you accept walk-ins?

Walk-ins are welcome if a room/device is free, but booking is strongly recommended.

What should I wear/bring?

Comfortable clothing, a water bottle, and minimal fragrances. We provide sanitized eye masks/blankets upon request.

Payment methods & packages

We accept cash, major cards, and e-wallets. Multi-session packages and memberships offer the best value. Ask about current promos.

Minors

Guests under 18 must be accompanied by a parent/guardian who can give written consent.

Health & safety

Devices are disinfected after each use. Please postpone visits if you have fever, contagious illness, or open wounds at the treatment site.

What is it?

A quiet room experience designed for deep rest/relaxation. Guests typically sit or recline in a calm environment.

What happens during a session?

You rest, meditate, or nap. Many guests report feeling calm, warm, or lightly tingly; some feel sleepy.

How long is a session?

Common options are 60–120 minutes. First-time guests often start with 60 minutes.

How often should I come?

For general relaxation: 1–2×/week is common. Listen to your body and your schedule.

How do I prepare/what to bring?

Hydrate well, arrive lightly fed, silence devices. Optional: socks, eye mask, journal.

Aftercare

Drink plenty of water, add light movement, and prioritize rest the remainder of the day.

Who should consult a clinician first?

If you are pregnant, have implanted electronic devices (e.g., pacemaker), a history of seizures, or any condition you’re concerned about—please speak with your clinician before booking.

What is it?

A non-invasive light exposure using visible red and near-infrared wavelengths to support general wellness and recovery.

Is it a tanning bed?

No. There’s no UV and no tanning effect.

How long is a session?

Typically 10–20 minutes per area. Multi-area sessions can be stacked.

How often should I come?

For best results, many start at 2–5×/week for 4–6 weeks, then move to maintenance (1–2×/week). You can scale to your goals.

What should I wear/bring?

Expose the area you want to target. Come with clean, dry skin (no makeup, sunscreen, or heavy lotions). We provide eye protection if needed.

What will I feel?

Gentle warmth at most. Skin may appear slightly flushed for a few minutes afterward.

Who should avoid or get medical clearance first?

Photosensitive conditions (e.g., lupus, porphyria); photosensitizing meds (certain antibiotics, isotretinoin, high-dose retinoids); active malignancy; pregnancy (especially direct abdominal exposure); recent eye surgery/retinal conditions (avoid direct eye exposure). If unsure, bring your clinician’s guidance.

Tattoos & cosmetics

Tattoos can warm up; let us know so we can adjust time/distance. Remove reflective cosmetics on the area before treatment.

What is it?

Purified water infused with dissolved molecular hydrogen (H₂). It’s different from alkaline or flavored waters.

How is it served?

By-the-glass in the studio or in sealed take-home bottles. Please bring a clean, airtight bottle if you prefer refills.

When should I drink it?

Hydrogen dissipates over time. For best experience, drink soon after dispensing or within the same day. Keep sealed and refrigerated if not consumed immediately.

How much should I drink?

Commonly 250–500 mL per serving, 1–2×/day. Adjust to your preference and hydration needs (this is not medical advice).

Taste & safety

Tastes like regular water. Generally well-tolerated; if you are pregnant, breastfeeding, have kidney issues, or complex medical conditions, consult your clinician.

Can I mix it with supplements/meds?

Separate from medications unless your clinician says otherwise. Avoid mixing with oxidizing agents.

Quality checks

We maintain our system per manufacturer guidance and perform routine checks. Ask staff about our latest maintenance log.

Who are your programs for?

Anyone looking to build sustainable habits for better health and performance.

Do I need experience to join?

No. Our events are beginner-friendly with options for all levels.

Are sessions recorded?

Some online workshops are recorded. Check the event details for availability.

Do you offer team workshops?

Yes. We can design custom sessions for teams and organizations.

What is your refund policy?

For paid events, we offer refunds up to 48 hours before the start time.
